intro: Neophloga rhodotricha, commonly known as the red-haired moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and vibrant red to orange hues in its leafy structures. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions with high humidity. Its leaves are usually curved and have a distinct midrib, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Neophloga rhodotricha plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its native ecosystems.
